items.title: Indian D2C fashion brand Rare Rabbit secures $5.7m
items.author: Manish Poddar, Akshika Poddar
items.summary:
- Rare Rabbit secured 50 crore rupee (US$5.7 million) in funding from A91 Partners.
- The funding is part of a larger round totaling 500 crore rupee (US$57.5 million).
- 23,073 shares were issued at 21,670 rupee (US$249.44) each.
- The company increased its authorized share capital in January for growth and working capital.
- Founded in 2015, Rare Rabbit operates brands like Rare Rabbit, Rareism, and Articale.
- The company reported a 69% increase in operating revenue to 637 crore rupee (US$73.32 million) for 2023-24, with net profit doubling to 74.5 crore rupee (US$85.75 million).

items.title: Paytm targets profit in 2026 with credit focus
items.summary:
- Paytm aims to achieve profitability by 2026, focusing on its credit services.
- The company's strategy includes enhancing its loan offerings to drive revenue.
- Paytm's management highlights the importance of customer growth and credit expansion.

items.title: Why this investor is all in on deeptech
items.summary:
- The investor is heavily focused on investing in deeptech startups.
- Emphasis on the transformative potential of deeptech in various industries.
- Insights into market trends and future opportunities within the deeptech sector.

items.title: India’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article provides insights into startup funding in India, segmented into a weekly update and macro trends.
- Recent notable investors and companies in the region are highlighted.
- Funding distribution across various verticals and stages is analyzed with data-driven visuals (charts and graphics).

items.title: Qiming’s managing partner steps down after 19 years
items.summary:
- Qiming Venture Partners’ managing partner announced his departure after 19 years with the firm.
- The decision comes as part of a transition strategy within the company.
- Qiming will continue to focus on its investment strategies and portfolio management moving forward.

items.title: Samsung nominates key leaders to strengthen chip business
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics has nominated Jun Young-hyun (semiconductor division head) and Song Jai-hyuk (chief technology officer) for its board of directors.
- The nominations include Lee Hyuk-jae, a chip expert from Seoul National University, as an external director.
- This move aims to strengthen Samsung's position in the semiconductor business amid competition, especially after losing ground in the HBM chip market to SK Hynix.
- The proposed nominees will be reviewed at the shareholders' meeting on March 19.

items.title: Former OpenAI scientist’s startup raises $1b, valued at $30b
items.author: Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Levy, Daniel Gross
items.summary:
- Safe Superintelligence (SSI) raises over US$1 billion in funding.
- The company is valued at more than US$30 billion, up from US$20 billion just ten days prior.
- The funding round is led by Greenoaks Capital Partners, contributing US$500 million.
- SSI focuses on developing AI that surpasses human intelligence while aligning with human interests.

items.title: China’s Ninebot, Niu upgrade e-scooters with DeepSeek AI
items.summary:
- Chinese electric two-wheeler brands Ninebot and Niu Technologies are enhancing their products with AI models developed by DeepSeek.
- On Feb. 14, Segway-Ninebot Group, backed by Xiaomi, announced plans to implement DeepSeek’s technology for product intelligence enhancements.
- Users can expect features like AI-powered content creation, personalized recommendations, analytics, and improved mobile app services.
- Niu Technologies reported full integration of DeepSeek’s large language models into its e-scooters on the same day.

items.title: TikTok recognized for leading teen user safety: report
items.summary:
- TikTok has been acknowledged as a leader in enhancing user safety for teenagers.
- This recognition is part of the Infocomm Media Development Authority's Online Safety Assessment Report.
- The platform requires users to be at least 13 years old to create an account.
- Features for users aged 13 to 17 include restricted direct messaging and limited account visibility.
- TikTok has launched initiatives in Singapore like the Wellness Hub for mental health and a scam prevention edition.
- The platform collaborates with organizations to boost digital literacy and manage misinformation.

items.title: Samsung cancels $2.11b in shares, plans $2.7b buyback
CarDekho reports $39.15m loss, plans $500m IPO
items.summary:
- CarDekho reported a loss of $39.15 million.
- The company is planning an Initial Public Offering (IPO) worth $500 million.
- This marks a significant financial move for CarDekho in the automotive sector.

items.title: Malaysia’s semiconductor sector thrives as US-China tensions
items.summary:
- Malaysia's semiconductor industry is experiencing growth amid rising US-China tensions.
- The country is becoming a destination for semiconductor manufacturing as companies seek to diversify supply chains.
- Investments in the sector are increasing, with new projects and expansions reported in recent months.

items.title: Xi Jinping meets Alibaba, Huawei, Xiaomi, BYD CEOs
items.summary:
- On Feb. 17, Xi Jinping met with CEOs from major industries to boost confidence in the private sector.
- Notable attendees included Jack Ma of Alibaba, and executives from Huawei, Xiaomi, and BYD.
- Other participants were Robin Zeng from CATL, Pony Ma from Tencent, and representatives from Meituan and Qi An Xin Technology.
- The meeting aims to restore confidence in China's private sector after past regulatory challenges.

items.title: AI security startup Dream secures $100m, valued at $1.1b
items.summary:
- Dream, an AI-based security firm, secured US$100 million in funding on Feb. 17.
- The funding round was led by Bain Capital Ventures, valuing the company at US$1.1 billion.
- Other investors included Group 11, Tru Arrow, Tau Capital, and Aleph.
- This investment reflects ongoing interest in AI despite a slowing broader venture capital market.

items.title: Taiwan’s semiconductor industry hits $152.7b in 2024: report
items.summary:
- Taiwan's semiconductor industry surpassed NT$5 trillion (US$152.7 billion) in output for the first time in 2024.
- Total output was NT$5.32 trillion (US$162.6 billion), marking a 22.4% increase from the previous year.
- Integrated circuit (IC) manufacturing led the growth with a 28.4% increase, totaling NT$3.42 trillion (US$104.4 billion).
- Taiwan's semiconductor growth outpaced the global industry growth of 19.1% in 2024.
- Forecasts predict continued growth in 2025, exceeding global growth expectations of 11.2%.

items.title: Mistral launches AI model for Arabic languages
items.summary:
- Paris-based AI startup Mistral has launched a new language model named Mistral Saba, designed for Arabic-speaking regions.
- The model contains 24 billion parameters aimed to improve interactions in Arabic.
- It is also effective with South Asian languages like Tamil and Malayalam due to cultural ties.
- The model is available through an API and can be deployed on-premise.

items.title: TSMC’s US expansion on track despite groundbreaking rumors
items.summary:
- TSMC announced on Feb. 17 that its investment projects in Arizona are proceeding as planned.
- This statement was in response to local media reports about the timeline for its third wafer fabrication plant in the US.
- TSMC confirmed a total investment of over US$65 billion in Arizona to build three advanced wafer fabs.
- The first facility is producing chips using the 4-nanometer process.
- The second fab is set for mass production in 2028, and the third is expected by the end of the decade.

items.title: Standard Chartered plans HK’s first licensed stablecoin
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Standard Chartered intends to apply for a license to issue a Hong Kong dollar-backed stablecoin on Feb. 17.
- The bank is partnering with Animoca Brands and HKT to enhance domestic and cross-border payment capabilities.
- The licensing application will be submitted to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority.
- Mary Huen, CEO of Standard Chartered’s Hong Kong division, is enthusiastic about being one of the first issuers of an HKD-backed stablecoin.

items.title: Stc Group launches sovereign cloud for Saudi AI developers
items.summary:
- Stc Group launches a sovereign cloud platform through its AI subsidiary stc.AI, operational later this year.
- The platform features Stc Enterprise GPT, which utilizes generative AI for content generation.
- Designed to support local developers, it promotes enterprise-level AI innovation through an open-source software model.
- The platform is built in partnership with SambaNova Systems, highlighting high efficiency and rapid inference speeds.

items.title: VinFast’s reliance on GSM for growth faces uncertainty
items.summary:
- VinFast relies on Green and Smart Mobility (GSM) for sales, but this dependency is diminishing.
- Deliveries to GSM dropped from 72% in 2023 to 38% in the first nine months of 2024.
- GSM has expanded its fleet and surpassed Grab in the Vietnamese ride-hailing sector but may face limitations in growth.
- Analysts suggest GSM may need to explore new strategies for growth to maintain its relevance for VinFast.

items.title: Taiwan stocks rise 1.52% as TSMC surges
items.summary:
- Taiwan's stocks bounced back on February 17, 2025, with the Taiex index increasing by 1.52% to close at 23,505.33.
- The turnover for the day was NT$363.42 billion (US$11.11 billion).
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) rose by 2.30% to NT$1,085.00, contributing nearly 200 points to the index's rise.
- The electronics index climbed by 1.86%, and the semiconductor sub-index saw a 2.25% increase.

items.title: PH ride-hailing platform’s CEO driving license suspended
items.summary:
- George Royeca, CEO of Angkas, had his driver’s license suspended for 90 days due to a traffic incident.
- The incident involved Angkas riders blocking traffic for Royeca's motorcade in Rizal province.
- Royeca admitted responsibility and expressed regret in a public apology on February 3, stating Angkas is cooperating with authorities.
- He acknowledged the situation as a failure in discipline, safety, and compliance.

items.title: FTX to repay small creditors starting Feb. 18
items.summary:
- FTX will begin creditor repayments on February 18, focusing on convenience class creditors with claims under $50,000.
- Eligible creditors will receive 119% of their claim value, totaling around $1.2 billion.
- Larger claims over $50,000 will be addressed starting in Q2 2025.
- Overall, FTX intends to distribute about $17 billion across various stages of repayment.
- Creditors must complete the KYC verification process and provide necessary documentation to qualify for payments.
- FTX collapsed due to a liquidity crisis and subsequent bankruptcy in late 2022, resulting in significant legal repercussions for executives like Sam Bankman-Fried, who was sentenced to 25 years in prison.

items.title: Baidu shares plunge as founder misses tech summit with Xi Jinping
items.summary:
- Baidu's shares dropped by 7% on February 17, leading to a market value loss of $2.4 billion.
- The stock decline followed the absence of Baidu's founder, Robin Li, from a key meeting in Beijing with President Xi Jinping and other tech leaders.
- Personalities such as Alibaba's Jack Ma and Huawei's Ren Zhengfei attended the summit, and Li's absence was notably highlighted during the event.
- Baidu has not publicly commented on Robin Li's absence from the meeting.

items.title: Indian B2B firm Udaan secures $75m funding, valued at $1.8b
items.summary:
- Udaan, a Bengaluru-based B2B ecommerce firm, raised US$75 million from Lightspeed Venture Partners and M&G Prudential.
- An additional $25 million in funding may occur in the coming quarter.
- The latest funding values Udaan at approximately US$1.8 billion, reflecting a reduced valuation from 2023.
- Lightspeed holds around 40% of Udaan, while M&G Prudential is expected to increase its stake.

items.title: NaturalX secures $105m for European consumer health startups
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- NaturalX Health Ventures launches a €100 million (US$105 million) fund for European consumer health startups.
- The fund targets innovation in proactive health management at the intersection of wellness and medicine.
- Primarily invests in series A financing, with flexibility for late seed and series B rounds.
- Initial investments range from €3 million to €5 million, with follow-on investments up to €10 million.
- The venture focuses on European startups and may consider selected investments in North America.
- Founded by Marvin Amberg, in partnership with Schwabe Group, known for plant-based pharmaceuticals.

items.title: Shein plans to cut valuation to $30b for London IPO: sources
items.summary:
- Shein's valuation may be reduced to approximately US$30 billion ahead of its IPO in the UK.
- The company was valued over US$100 billion in 2022 but has declined due to private market sales and other factors.
- Shein initially planned a US IPO but shifted to a London listing after those plans faltered, having filed confidentially in June 2023.
- As of early 2023, estimates of Shein's valuation were around US$45 billion.
- Shein has not commented on the reduction in valuation or the IPO status.

items.title: DeepSeek challenges OpenAI with R1 model
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI lab, unveiled its R1 model, developed for under US$6 million, outpacing US rivals like OpenAI in cost.
- The R1 model reportedly matches OpenAI's O1 in performance while being more energy-efficient.
- Concerns about censorship arise as the model avoids politically sensitive topics.
- OpenAI questions DeepSeek's cost claims, suggesting expenses exceed US$500 million and the possibility of model "distillation."

items.title: A big L for eFishery: layoffs
items.summary:
- eFishery has ramped up layoffs with up to 90% of staff potentially affected.
- Internal probe revealed the company allegedly overstated its revenue by US$600 million.
- Co-founders stepped down amid financial fraud allegations; FTI Consulting took over management.
- A shareholders meeting is expected to determine the company's future.

items.title: 20 top angel investment networks in Asia
items.summary:
- High net-worth individuals are seeking to diversify investments as they steadily increase globally.
- Interest in angel investors is rising as tech startups mature and gain reputability.
- Angel investment networks are popular for providing access to deal flow and mitigating investment risks.
- The article features a list updated with deals from the past two years, inviting corrections to the dataset.

items.title: India’s DroneAcharya stock tumbles to all-time low
items.summary:
- Shares of DroneAcharya Aerial Innovations dropped 6.6% to an all-time low of 73 rupees (US$0.84) on Feb. 17, marking an 8-day losing streak.
- The company’s market cap fell to 176.56 crore rupees (US$20 million), with shares down 20.8% since Feb. 4 and 55.4% over the past year.
- Founded in 2017, DroneAcharya provides drone services such as multi-sensor surveys, pilot training, and data processing.
- The company’s profit dropped 62.1% to 1.50 crore rupees (US$172.7 million) in H1 FY25, while revenue rose 28.8% to 26.90 crore rupees (US$3 million).
- It signed a merger term sheet with AITMC Ventures, an agricultural drone company, earlier this year.

items.title: South Korea plans 10,000 GPUs for AI center by 2025
items.author: Choi Sang-mok
items.summary:
- South Korea's government plans to acquire 10,000 GPUs by 2025 for a national AI computing center.
- The announcement was made by Acting President Choi Sang-mok during a government-private sector meeting.
- South Korea currently has around 2,000 GPUs, essential for AI development.
- The GPUs will include Nvidia’s H100 and H200 models to enhance AI infrastructure.

items.title: EaseMyTrip shares drop to 52-week low after Q3 results
items.summary:
- Shares of EaseMyTrip dropped to a 52-week low of 11.35 rupees ($0.1307) on Feb. 17, 2025.
- The stock recovered to 11.68 rupees ($0.1345) later that day, down 2.1%.
- The company's market capitalization was 4,153.66 crore rupees ($478.4 million).
- EaseMyTrip reported a 26% year-on-year decline in consolidated profit after tax (PAT), totaling 34.02 crore rupees ($3.92 million).
- Operating revenue decreased by 6% to 150.56 crore rupees ($17.34 million) for Q3 FY25 from the previous year's 160.78 crore rupees ($18.52 million).
- The decline reflects a broader drop in Indian benchmark indices amid market concerns.

items.title: China urges Xiaohongshu to include state investor for IPO
items.summary:
- Chinese regulators suggest Xiaohongshu consider including a state-owned investor for easier IPO approval.
- Ongoing discussions; no comments from Xiaohongshu or the China securities regulatory commission.
- Xiaohongshu, akin to Instagram, is gaining global popularity, especially in the US amid TikTok's regulatory issues.
- This suggestion indicates a regulatory shift to support the tech sector, with a planned share sale in Hong Kong.

items.title: Friction in Google Cloud’s APAC arm
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Google Cloud's APAC division is experiencing internal cultural friction, causing concern among employees and affecting morale.
- Reports suggest a decline in hiring and diversity standards within the team, opposing the company's values of respect and transparency.
- The APAC market is less profitable than North America and Europe but has significant growth potential if issues are effectively addressed.

items.title: Lenskart plans $10b IPO filing by May 2025
items.summary:
- Lenskart plans to file draft papers for its IPO by May 2025.
- The targeted valuation is ₹86,765 crore (US$10 billion), which is double its latest funding round.
- Kotak Mahindra Bank and Morgan Stanley are engaged as underwriters for the IPO.
- The IPO is expected to take place in Mumbai, though Lenskart has not officially confirmed these plans.
- More updates are anticipated as additional details emerge.

items.title: Adani-backed firm among finalists for India’s rocket deal
items.summary:
- An Adani Group-backed firm is among the finalists for a significant Indian rocket deal.
- The decision is part of India's push to enhance its space capabilities and commercial space exploration.
- The final decision on the deal is expected soon, potentially reshaping the Indian aerospace sector.

items.title: Apple adds AI features, spatial content app to Vision Pro
items.summary:
- Apple plans to upgrade Vision Pro headset with new features via visionOS 2.4.
- New features include Apple Intelligence, guest mode, and a spatial content app.
- Apple Intelligence will provide writing tools, genmojis, and image playground utilizing M2 chip and 16GB memory.
- The spatial content app will support 3D images, panoramas, and feature an arctic surfing video on Feb. 21.
- Guest mode improvements will allow access management via iPhone for easier headset sharing.
- Updates aim to enhance Vision Pro's competitiveness against Google and other mixed-reality devices.

items.title: Japanese chipmaker Kioxia reports $2.7b profit, stock up 19%
items.summary:
- Kioxia shares surged 19% on Feb. 17, the largest gain since its IPO in December 2024.
- Reported an operating profit of 415 billion yen (US$2.7 billion) for the nine-month period ending December, recovering from a 297 billion yen (US$1.9 billion) loss.
- Full-year operating income expected to be between 431 billion yen (US$2.8 billion) and 453 billion yen (US$3 billion) due to anticipated growth in demand for smartphones and PCs.
- Shares traded at 2,172 yen (US$14.3) on Feb. 17, nearly 50% above the IPO price of 1,455 yen (US$9.6).
- Analysts noted stable demand from data centers and enterprises; this is Kioxia's first earnings report since its late 2024 IPO.

items.title: Goldman lifts China stock target on AI-driven gains
items.summary:
- Goldman Sachs raises the 12-month target price for the CSI300 index to 4,700, from 4,600.
- The MSCI China index target increased to 85, up from 75.
- The adjustment follows a surge in Chinese technology stocks, marking their strongest rally in over two years.
- Improved market sentiment is attributed to advancements in AI by DeepSeek.
- As of February 17, the CSI300 index was at 3,954.

items.title: Tencent shares jump 6.6% on WeChat AI chatbot integration
items.summary:
- Tencent shares increased by 6.6% in Hong Kong on February 17.
- The surge is due to plans to integrate DeepSeek’s R1 reasoning chatbot into WeChat.
- This integration aligns Tencent with the growing use of DeepSeek’s AI software in various sectors in China.
- Tencent had a successful year with new game releases and a 67% rise in stock value over the past year.

items.title: PropertyGuru axes 174 employees, shuts 3 business units
items.summary:
- PropertyGuru laid off 174 employees (12% of its workforce) on February 13, 2024, following its buyout by EQT Capital.
- Three business units, including Sendhelper, PropertyGuru Finance, and data solutions, are being shut down.
- Affected employees will receive severance packages, extended medical insurance, and support services, including relocation assistance.

items.title: SG fintech firm Lendela hires new CFO, CTO
items.summary:
- Lendela appoints Kent Huang as CFO and Steven Wong as CTO.
- Appointments aim to enhance executive leadership as the company expands in Asia Pacific.
- Huang has 20 years of experience, previously at PayPal and Intuit.
- Wong brings over 15 years of experience in technology for high-growth startups.
- Recent news includes Lendela raising $5M for expansion after achieving profitability in Singapore and Hong Kong.

items.title: Indonesian healthtech startup Nexmedis secures funding
items.summary:
- Nexmedis, an AI-powered health information systems provider in Indonesia, secured undisclosed funding co-led by East Ventures and Forge Ventures.
- Founded in 2023, the startup offers Clinical Decision Support tools to assist healthcare professionals.
- Since launch, it has partnered with over 400 healthcare facilities and participated in Indonesia’s Ministry of Health Regulatory Sandbox program.
- The funding will support Nexmedis’ hospital expansion and improve its AI-driven solutions in healthcare.

items.title: VC funds tracker: latest on East Ventures, SV Investment
items.summary:
- Fundraising in Southeast Asia and India remains challenging, with a regularly updated list of active VC funds for startups.
- In 2025, over US$1.8 billion in investment vehicles launched, following nearly US$17 billion committed across 77 VC funds in 2024, a record high.
- A rising number of AI-focused funds increased from 4 to 12 within two years, highlighting the sector's current popularity.
- Majority of VCs are based in Southeast Asia, and they mainly target early-stage startups while late-stage funding remains limited.

items.title: TSMC leads Taiwan patent applications in 2024
items.summary:
- TSMC filed 1,412 invention patents, leading Taiwan's patent applications in 2024.
- Nanya Technology came second with 466 patents, a 25% increase from 2023.
- Other notable filings: AUO Corp (425), Industrial Technology Research Institute (356), and MediaTek (239), which saw a 56% decline.
- Applied Materials led foreign applicants with 950 patents, a 29% rise; Samsung Electronics followed with 894 patents, down 8%.
- Huawei ranked 17th with 184 patents, marking a 28% increase from 2023.

items.title: India’s ePlane to supply 788 air ambulances in $1b deal
items.summary:
- India’s ePlane has signed a deal worth $1 billion to supply 788 air ambulances.
- The air ambulances are expected to enhance emergency medical services in the country.
- This deal signifies a major advancement in India’s aviation and healthcare sectors.

items.title: UK researchers develop AI to monitor animal emotions
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Scientists are using AI to enhance animal welfare by detecting facial expressions that indicate stress, pain, or discomfort.
- The notable system, Intellipig, was developed by researchers from the University of the West of England Bristol (UWE) and Scotland’s Rural College (SRUC).
- Intellipig uses cameras to analyze pigs’ facial features as they enter feeding stalls, alerting farmers to signs of distress.
- AI applications in animal welfare extend to various species, including horses, cats, and sheep.
- Researchers have developed algorithms that detect pain or stress by identifying facial points such as the edges of the eyes and nostrils.
- These systems can perform tasks more quickly and accurately than humans, detecting subtle facial movements that might go unnoticed.
- Experts emphasize the need for oversight and continued refinement to capture more complex aspects of animal emotions.

items.title: South Korea suspends access to DeepSeek
items.summary:
- South Korea suspended the domestic operations of the Chinese AI app DeepSeek on Feb. 15, 2025.
- The decision was announced by the country’s data protection authority on Feb. 17, 2025.
- Suspension will remain until DeepSeek complies with South Korea’s privacy regulations.

items.title: Spotify plans $6 Music Pro service with AI, ticket perks
items.summary:
- Spotify is developing a new premium service called Music Pro costing an additional US$5.99 per month.
- Expected launch is in late 2025, with regional pricing variations.
- Music Pro will feature AI-powered tools like song mixing and benefits for live events, including presale access and better seating.
- Spotify is negotiating with music promoters and ticket sellers, though details are not finalized.
- This move comes as Spotify faces slow growth in North America and Europe, competing with services like Apple Music and Amazon Music Unlimited.
- Spotify currently has 675 million users globally.
